This Licence is based on the PA/JISC and the NESLI model licence for journals.</onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex000404"> <onix:SortNumber>0.4.4</onix:SortNumber> <onix:Text>4. JISC Collections (as hereafter defined) has developed an online ordering service; the ‘JISC Collections Online Ordering Service’, whereby nominated persons can place, order, and manage subscriptions online on behalf of their institution, which will be used in connection with this Licence. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex000406"> <onix:SortNumber>0.4.5</onix:SortNumber> <onix:Text>5. The terms of this Licence and the offer for [product] were negotiated and agreed under the [insert product name] agreement between the Publisher and JISC Collections dated [insert date] as part of NESLi2, the electronic journals licensing initiative for UK higher and further education institutions and their users. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex0005"> <onix:SortNumber>0.5</onix:SortNumber> <onix:Text>IT IS AGREED AS FOLLOWS</onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex0100"> <onix:SortNumber>1.0</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>1.</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>DEFINITIONS</onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex010100"> <onix:SortNumber>1.1.0</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>1.1</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>In this Licence, the following terms shall have the following meanings:</onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex010101"> <onix:SortNumber>1.1.1</onix:SortNumber> <onix:Text>"Authorised User" means an individual who is authorised by an Authorised Institution to have access to its information services (whether on-site or off-site) via Secure Authentication and who is:
- a current student of that Authorised Institution;
- a member of staff (whether permanent or temporary including retired members of staff) of that Authorised Institution;
- a contractor engaged by that Authorised Institution whose contract requires access to the Licensed Material;
- any teaching and/or library staff who at the request of the Authorised Institution provide support to current students of that Authorised Institution;
- a Walk-In User
Walk-In Users are persons who are allowed by the Institution to access its information services from computer terminals or otherwise within the physical premises of the Institution. For the avoidance of doubt, Walk-In Users may be given access to the Licensed Material by any wireless Secure Network. Walk-In Users are not allowed off-site access to the Licensed Material. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex010102"> <onix:SortNumber>1.1.2</onix:SortNumber> <onix:Text>"Commercial Use" means use for the purpose of monetary reward (whether by or for the Institution or an Authorised User) by means of the sale, resale, loan, transfer, hire or other form of exploitation of the Licensed Material. For the avoidance of doubt, neither recovery of direct cost by the Institution from Authorised Users, nor use by the Institution or Authorised Users of the Licensed Material in the course of research funded by a commercial organisation is deemed to constitute Commercial Use. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="d1e108d1e168920111115T100219.812Z"> <onix:SortNumber>1.1.3</onix:SortNumber> <onix:Text>"Core Collection" means the core collection of journals selected by the Institution from the Licensed Material. The core collection will be updated by the Publisher in consultation with the Institution at least annually. The Publisher will list the selected journals in the core collection of each Institution in Schedule 2 of such Institution’s NESLi2 Licence for Journals. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex010103"> <onix:SortNumber>1.1.4</onix:SortNumber> <onix:Text>"Educational Purposes" means use for the purpose of education, teaching, distance learning, private study and/or research. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex010104"> <onix:SortNumber>1.1.5</onix:SortNumber> <onix:Text>"Fee" means the fee as set out in Schedule 1. The fee will be in line with the Offer. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex010105"> <onix:SortNumber>1.1.6</onix:SortNumber> <onix:Text>"JISC Collections" means the JISC Content Procurement Company Limited (trading as JISC Collections) (Company Number 05747339), a company incorporated in England and Wales and limited by guarantee whose registered offices is at Ground Floor, Brettenham House South, Lancaster Place, London WC2E 7EN. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex01010600"> <onix:SortNumber>1.1.7</onix:SortNumber> <onix:Text>"JISC Collections Online Ordering Service" means the online subscription ordering service developed by JISC Collections. The JISC Collections Online Ordering Service can be found at www.jisc-collections.ac.uk. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex010106"> <onix:SortNumber>1.1.8</onix:SortNumber> <onix:Text>"Licensed Material" means the material listed in Schedule 2.</onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="d1e108d1e168920090324T200909.14Z"> <onix:SortNumber>1.1.9</onix:SortNumber> <onix:Text>"Offer" means the offer agreed between JISC Collections and the Publisher for [insert product name] within the framework of NESLI2 as set out in Annex 1. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex010107"> <onix:SortNumber>1.1.10</onix:SortNumber> <onix:Text>"Order Confirmation Email (Institution)" means the email to the Institution, automatically generated by the JISC Online Ordering Service after the Institution has completed the Subscription Order and Acceptance Form, confirming that the Institution has placed the order, the start and end date of the subscription period and that the Institution has agreed to the terms and conditions of the Licence. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex010108"> <onix:SortNumber>1.1.11</onix:SortNumber> <onix:Text>"Order Confirmation Email (JISC Collections)" means the email to JISC Collections, automatically generated by the JISC Online Ordering Service after the Licensee has completed the Subscription Order and Acceptance Form, confirming that the Institution has placed the order, the start and end date of the subscription period and that the Institution has agreed to the terms and conditions of the Licence. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex010109"> <onix:SortNumber>1.1.12</onix:SortNumber> <onix:Text>"Order Confirmation Email (Publisher)" means the email to the Publisher, automatically generated by the JISC Online Ordering Service after the Institution has completed the Subscription Order and Acceptance Form, confirming that the Institution has placed the order, the start and end date of the subscription period and that the Institution has agreed to the terms and conditions of the Licence.
</onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="d1e108d1e168920110930T091546.781Z"> <onix:SortNumber>1.1.13</onix:SortNumber> <onix:Text>"Secure Authentication" means access to the Licensed Material by UK Access Management Federation compliant technology, Internet Protocol (“IP”) ranges or by a username and password provided by the Institution or by another means of authentication agreed between the Publisher and the Institution. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="d1e108d1e168920110930T091633.656Z"> <onix:SortNumber>1.1.14</onix:SortNumber> <onix:Text>"Secure Network" means a network which is only accessible to Authorised Users by Secure Authentication. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="d1e108d1e168920110930T091707.796Z"> <onix:SortNumber>1.1.15</onix:SortNumber> <onix:Text>"Subscription Order and Acceptance Form" means the form used by JISC Collections as part of the JISC Collections Online Ordering Service. A sample copy of the form is attached to this Licence in Annex 2. Once the completed form has been received by the JISC Collections Online Ordering Service, the system automatically generates an Order Confirmation Email (Institution) to the Institution, Order Confirmation Email (JISC Collection) to JISC Collections and an Order Confirmation Email (Publisher) to the Publisher repeating the information on the form regarding the name of the Institution, the resource, the start and end date of the Subscription Period and confirming the date on which the Institution accepted the terms and conditions of the Licence. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="d1e108d1e168920110930T091749.921Z"> <onix:SortNumber>1.1.16</onix:SortNumber> <onix:Text>"Subscription Period" means the period from [insert date] until [insert date].</onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex0102"> <onix:SortNumber>1.2</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>1.2</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>Headings in this Licence are for </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex0801"> <onix:SortNumber>8.1</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>8.1</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>The term of this Agreement will commence upon the start date as set out in the Subscription Order and Acceptance Form (and subsequently in the Order Confirmation Email (Institution) and Order Confirmation Email (Publisher)) and will remain in full force and effect until the end of the Subscription Period as set out in such Subscription Order and Acceptance Form, unless terminated earlier as provided for in this Clause 8. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="d1e108d1e168920100423T140402.938Z"> <onix:SortNumber>8.2</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>8.2</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>The Institution may terminate this Licence at any time if sufficient funds are not provided or allotted in the library budget by the appropriate body of the Institution for the Licensed Material. In the event that the Institution wishes to terminate this Licence after the first twelve months of the term of this Licence, the Institution should notify the Publisher three months prior to the first anniversary date of this Licence. The same applies for terminations for subsequent years. Any such termination will become effective on 1st January of the relevant year. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex0802"> <onix:SortNumber>8.3</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>8.3</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>Any party may terminate this Licence at any time on the material breach or repeated other breaches by the other of any obligation on its part under this Licence by serving a written notice on the other identifying the nature of the breach. The termination will become effective thirty days after receipt of the written notice unless during the relevant period of thirty (30) days the defaulting party remedies the breach forthwith by written notice to the other party. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex0803"> <onix:SortNumber>8.4</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>8.4</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>Upon termination of this Licence by the Publisher due to a material breach or repeated other breaches by the Institution, the Publisher shall cease to authorise on-line access to the Licensed Material by the Institution and Authorised Users. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex0804"> <onix:SortNumber>8.5</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>8.5</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>In the case of termination of this Licence (except for a material breach by the Institution of its obligations under this Licence), the Publisher will provide (at the option of the Institution) the Institution and its Authorised Users with continuous access to and use of the full text of the Licensed Material which was published and paid for during the term of this Licence and preceding Licences (where applicable) between the Publisher and the Institution, without charge, either by one or more of the following options:
i) continuing online access to archival copies of the same Licensed Material on the Publisher's server;
ii) supplying archival copies of the same Licensed Material to the Institution in an electronic medium mutually agreed between the parties;
iii) supplying archival copies of the same Licensed Material to a central archiving facility operated on behalf of the UK HE/FE community or other archival facility;
iv) granting access to the same Licensed Material through one of the e-journals archiving solutions as listed in Schedule 5 (1);
For the avoidance of doubt access and use of archival copies shall be subject to the terms and conditions as set out in Clauses 3 and 4 of this Licence.
</onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex0805"> <onix:SortNumber>8.6</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>8.6</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>The Institution is permitted to:
- mount the archival copies of the Licensed Material supplied by the Publisher in accordance with Clauses 8.5 (ii) and 8.5 (iii):
- communicate, make available and provide access to such archival copies via a Secure Network to Authorised Users in accordance with the terms of this Licence; and
- make copies or re-format the Licensed Material contained in the archival copies in any way to ensure their future preservation and accessibility in accordance with this Licence. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex0806"> <onix:SortNumber>8.7</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>8.7</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>In the event that ownership of a part or parts of the Licensed Material is sold by the Publisher or otherwise transferred to another publisher, the Publisher will use all reasonable efforts to retain a non-exclusive copy of the volumes published during the Subscription Period and make them available without charge to the Institution:
(1) through the Publisher’s server; or
(2) by supplying such material without charge to the Institution in accordance with the procedure described in Clause 8.5. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex0807"> <onix:SortNumber>8.8</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>8.8</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>In the event that the Publisher ceases to publish a part or parts of the Licensed Material (including back issues of a title as part of the Licensed Material), the Publisher will:
- maintain a digital archive of such Licensed Material;
- will make the digital archive available to the Institution without charge through the Publisher’s server, via a third party server (including e-journals archiving initiatives as listed in Schedule 5 (1)) or by supplying the digital archive to the Institution without charge in accordance with the procedure described in Clause 8.5. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex0808"> <onix:SortNumber>8.9</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>8.9</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>The archival copies supplied in accordance with Clause 8.5 (ii) and (iii) will contain all textual content of the Licensed Material but will not contain all links and other features and functionality associated with the online version available via the Publisher’s server. Access and use of such copies will be free of charge. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex0809"> <onix:SortNumber>8.10</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>8.10</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>On termination of this Licence by the Institution due to a material breach or repeated other breaches by the Publisher, the Publisher will reimburse the Institution a pro rata proportion of the then remaining Fee for the unexpired part of the Subscription Period. The Publisher shall not be obligated to return any portion of the Fee for termination by the Publisher due to the Institution’s breach pursuant to Clause 8.3. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex0900"> <onix:SortNumber>9.0</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>9.</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>ACKNOWLEDGEMENT AND PROTECTION OF INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS</onix:Text> The Publisher will notify the Institution of any substantial change to the Licensed Material. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex1003"> <onix:SortNumber>10.3</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>10.3</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>While the Publisher has no reason to believe that there are any inaccuracies or defects in the information contained in the Licensed Material, the Publisher makes no representation and gives no warranty express or implied with regard to the information contained in or any part of the Licensed Material including (without limitation) the fitness of such information or part for any purposes whatsoever and the Publisher accepts no liability for loss suffered or incurred by the Institution or Authorised Users as a result of their reliance on the Licensed Material. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex1004"> <onix:SortNumber>10.4</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>10.4</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>In no circumstances will the Publisher be liable to the Institution for any loss resulting from a cause over which the Publisher does not have direct control, including but not limited to failure of electronic or mechanical equipment or communication lines, telephone or other interconnect problems, unauthorised access, theft, or operator errors. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex1005"> <onix:SortNumber>10.5</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>10.5</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>The Institution agrees to notify the Publisher immediately, provide full particulars in the event that it becomes aware of any actual or threatened claims by any third party in connection with any works contained in the Licensed Material and do all things reasonably required to assist the Publisher in such claims. It is expressly agreed that upon such notification, or if the Publisher becomes aware of such a claim from other sources, the Publisher may remove such work(s) from the Licensed Material. Failure to report knowledge of any actual or threatened claim by any third party shall be deemed a material breach of this Licence. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex1006"> <onix:SortNumber>10.6</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>10.6</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>Nothing in this Licence shall make the Institution liable for breach of the terms of this Licence by any Authorised User provided that the Institution did not cause, knowingly assist or condone the continuation of such breach after becoming aware of an actual breach having occurred. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex1007"> <onix:SortNumber>10.7</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>10.7</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>Except as provided for in Clause 10.1, neither the Institution nor the Publisher will be liable to the other in contract or negligence or otherwise for: (i) any special, indirect, incidental, punitive or consequential damages; (ii) loss of direct or indirect profits, business, contracts, revenue or anticipated savings; or (iii) for any increased costs or expenses. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex1008"> <onix:SortNumber>10.8</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>10.8</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>No party limits its liability for:
(i) death or personal injury to the extent it results from its negligence, or of its employees or agents in the course of their engagement; and

such party gives written notice thereof to the other party specifying the matters constituting Force Majeure together with such evidence as it reasonably can give and specifying the period for which for so long as such cause of prevention or delay shall continue. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex1200"> <onix:SortNumber>12.0</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>12.1</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>Except as permitted for under this Licence, neither this Licence nor any of the rights and obligations under it may be assigned by either party without obtaining the prior written consent of the other party, such consent shall not unreasonably be withheld or delayed. In any permitted assignment, the assignor shall procure and ensure that the assignee shall assume all rights and obligations of the assignor under this Licence and agrees to be bound to all the terms of this Licence. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex1300"> <onix:SortNumber>13.0</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>13.</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>GOVERNING LAW AND DISPUTE RESOLUTION</onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex1301"> <onix:SortNumber>13.1</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>13.1</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>This Licence shall be governed by and construed in accordance with English law and the parties irrevocably agree that any dispute arising out of or in connection with this Licence will be subject to and within the jurisdiction of the English courts. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex1302"> <onix:SortNumber>13.2</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>13.2</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>The parties agree to use best efforts to resolve disputes in an informal manner, by decision of the Managing Director of the Publisher and the current Vice Chancellor of the Institution. Where the parties agree that a dispute arising out or in connection with this Licence would best be resolved by the decision of an expert, they will agree upon the nature of the expert required and together appoint a suitable expert by agreement. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex1303"> <onix:SortNumber>13.3</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>13.3</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>Any person to whom a reference is made under Clause 13.2 shall act as expert and not as an arbitrator and his decision (which shall be given by him in writing and shall state the reasons for his decision) shall be final and binding on the parties except in the case of manifest error or fraud. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex1304"> <onix:SortNumber>13.4</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>13.4</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>Each party shall provide the expert with such information and documentation as he may reasonably require for the purposes of his decision. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex1305"> <onix:SortNumber>13.5</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>13.5</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>The costs of the expert shall be borne by the parties in such proportions as the expert may determine to be fair and reasonable in all circumstances or, if no determination is made by the expert, by the parties in equal proportions. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex1400"> <onix:SortNumber>14.0</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>14.</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>NOTICES</onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex140100"> <onix:SortNumber>14.1.0</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>14.1</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>All notices required to be given under this Licence shall be given in writing in English and sent by courier, or special delivery to the relevant addressee at its address set out below, or to such other address as may be notified by either party to the other from time to time under this Licence, and all such notices shall be deemed to have been received three (3) days after the date of posting in the case of [insert details]</onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex140102"> <onix:SortNumber>14.1.2</onix:SortNumber> <onix:Text>if to the Publisher: [insert details]</onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex1500"> <onix:SortNumber>15.0</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>15.</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>GENERAL</onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex1501"> <onix:SortNumber>15.1</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>15.1</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>This Licence and its Schedules and Annex constitute the entire agreement between the parties relating to the Licensed Material and supersede all prior communications, understandings and agreements (whether written or oral) relating to its subject matter and may not be amended or modified except by agreement of both parties in writing. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex1502"> <onix:SortNumber>15.2</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>15.2</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>The Schedules and Annex shall have the same force and effect as if expressly set in the body of this Licence and any reference to this Licence shall include the Schedules and Annex. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex1503"> <onix:SortNumber>15.3</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>15.3</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>The invalidity or unenforceability of any provision of this Licence shall not affect the continuation in force of the remainder of this Licence. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="Ex150401"> <onix:SortNumber>15.4</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>15.4</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>The rights of the parties arising under this Licence shall not be waived except in writing. Any waiver of any of a party's rights under this Licence or of any breach of this Licence by the other party shall not be construed as a waiver of any other rights or of any other or further breach. Failure by either party to exercise or enforce any rights conferred upon it by this Licence shall not be deemed to be a waiver of any such rights or operate so as to bar the exercise or enforcement thereof at any subsequent time or times. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> </onix:LicenseDocumentText> <onix:LicenseDocumentText> <onix:DocumentLabel>Schedule3</onix:DocumentLabel> <onix:TextElement id="d1e108d1e168920111122T120243.893Z"> <onix:SortNumber>0.</onix:SortNumber> <onix:Text>SCHEDULE 3: INDUSTRY STANDARDS</onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="d1e108d1e1689.2"> <onix:SortNumber>1.</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>1.</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>In order that the Authorised Institutions can fully assess the use and therefore value of the Licensed Material the Publisher will: </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="d1e108d1e168920111122T115233.719Z"> <onix:SortNumber>1.1</onix:SortNumber> <onix:TextPreceding>In order that the Authorised Institutions can fully assess the use and therefore value of the Licensed Material the Publisher will: </onix:TextPreceding> <onix:Text>Provide the Authorised Institutions with fully COUNTER-compliant usage statistics every three months (www.project counter.org) </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="d1e108d1e168920111122T115319.442Z"> <onix:SortNumber>1.2</onix:SortNumber> <onix:TextPreceding>In order that the Authorised Institutions can fully assess the use and therefore value of the Licensed Material the Publisher will: </onix:TextPreceding> <onix:Text>Implement the Standardized Usage Statistics Harvesting Initiative (SUSHI) protocol (http://www.niso.org/workrooms/sushi). </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="d1e108d1e168920111122T115416.554Z"> <onix:SortNumber>2.</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>2.</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>In order to ensure that the Licensed Material is archived and preserved for future scholarship, the Publisher will archive the Licensed Material in at least one of the following archiving solutions Portico, Clockss or Lockss and inform the Authorised Institutions in which of the archiving solutions the Licensed Material may be found. [DETAIL HERE THE ARCHIVING SOLUTIONS WHERE THE LICENSED MATERIAL HAS BEEN DEPOSITED] </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="d1e108d1e168920111122T115530.844Z"> <onix:SortNumber>3.</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>3.</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>In order to ensure that the Licenced Material is accessible to all the Authorised Users of the Authorised Institution, the Publisher will use all reasonable efforts to meet the W3C standards (www.w3.org/WAI/Resources/#in) </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="d1e108d1e168920111122T115613.104Z"> <onix:SortNumber>4.</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>4.</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>In order to ensure that Authorised Users can discover and find the Licensed Material, the Publishers will use all reasonable efforts to meet the Open URL Standard (www.niso.org/kst/reports/standards?step=2&gid=&project_key=d5320409c5160be4697dc046613f71b9a773cd9e). </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="d1e108d1e168920111122T115719.92Z"> <onix:SortNumber>5.</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>5.</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>In order to ensure accurate, up to date representation of the Licensed Material and to ensure Authorised Users have ease of access the Publisher will: </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="d1e108d1e168920111122T115810.778Z"> <onix:SortNumber>5.1</onix:SortNumber> <onix:TextPreceding>In order to ensure accurate, up to date representation of the Licensed Material and to ensure Authorised Users have ease of access the Publisher will: </onix:TextPreceding> <onix:Text>use all reasonable efforts to give the link-resolver vendors and A-Z vendors the following information about each title in the licensed material on a monthly basis:
• Title • ISSN or eISSN • Previous title, if appropriate • Previous ISSN or eISSN, if appropriate • First volume and issue made available as part of the offer or, if volume and issue are not available, first year, final volume and issue or year and URL. (You can get information on the names of the link resolver companies from JISC Collections.) </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="d1e108d1e168920111122T115849.85Z"> <onix:SortNumber>5.2</onix:SortNumber> <onix:TextPreceding>In order to ensure accurate, up to date representation of the Licensed Material and to ensure Authorised Users have ease of access the Publisher will: </onix:TextPreceding> <onix:Text>provide the link-resolver vendors with the algorithm or syntax for constructing an article-level link from an article’s metadata within the Licensed Material. </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> <onix:TextElement id="d1e108d1e168920111122T120042.486Z"> <onix:SortNumber>6.</onix:SortNumber> <onix:DisplayNumber>6.</onix:DisplayNumber> <onix:Text>In order to ensure that journal content remains easily accessible by Institutions and their Authorised Users when there is a transfer of material between parties, and to ensure that the transfer process occurs with minimum disruption, the Publisher will use all reasonable efforts to keep to the Code of Practice of Project Transfer (www.projecttransfer.org) and the KBART standards (http://www.uksg.org/kbart/s5/guidelines) and include the KBART 5.3.2.1: data fields and labels detailed below as columns in the tab separated metadata file. All fields should be considered to be mandatory if they exist, and all effort should be made to gather the data, even if it must be obtained from another area of the business or even from an external source.
publication_title - Publication title print_identifier - Print-format identifier (i.e., ISSN, ISBN, etc.) online_identifier - Online-format identifier (i.e., eISSN, eISBN, etc.) date_first_issue_online - Date of first issue available online num_first_vol_online - Number of first volume available online num_first_issue_online - Number of first issue available online date_last_issue_online - Date of last issue available online (or blank, if coverage is to present) num_last_vol_online - Number of last volume available online (or blank, if coverage is to present) num_last_issue_online - Number of last issue available online (or blank, if coverage is to present) title_url - Title-level URL first_author - First author (for monographs) title_id - Title ID embargo_info - Embargo information coverage_depth - Coverage depth (e.g., abstracts or full text) coverage_notes - Coverage notes publisher_name - Publisher name (if not given in the file’s title) </onix:Text> </onix:TextElement> </onix:LicenseDocumentText>
</onix:PublicationsLicenseExpression> </onix:ONIXPublicationsLicenseMessage>
